PHASE SUMMARY — Abbe Faria — early

Role: The Abbe Faria is a prisoner in the Chateau d'If, serving as a character in the narrative.

Traits: The Abbe Faria is described as an old man, a former leader of a group, and a man full of philanthropy, fit for his office as an inspector-general of prisons.

Relationships: The Abbe Faria interacts with the governor, showing a professional relationship.

Notable behaviors: The Abbe Faria is described as having considered the subject of the prisoners deeply, and his remark about the inspector-general suffering less is a demonstration of his philanthropy.
